episodeTitle: The Strongest Man in the Prison! Poison Man Magellan Appears!
episodeTitleJapanese: 監獄最強の男！毒人間・マゼラン登場
episodeTitleRomanized: Kangoku Saikyō no Otoko! Doku Ningen Mazeran Tōjō
description: Luffy and Buggy navigate Level 2's Wild Beast Hell, encountering dangerous creatures. Meanwhile, Hancock reaches Magellan's office on Level 4, where she meets the poison-wielding warden. Mr. 3 (Galdino) reunites with Luffy and Buggy during their escape attempt.

events.title: Luffy and Buggy Explore Level 2
events.description: Luffy and Buggy arrive in Level 2 (Wild Beast Hell) of Impel Down, discovering it's filled with dangerous creatures. The level houses prisoners with bounties exceeding 15,000,000 belly and features various monstrous beasts that chase inmates through corridors.
events.significance: Introduces the hostile environment of Level 2 and sets up encounters with the level's creatures and imprisoned criminals.

events.title: Luffy vs Basilisk
events.description: Luffy encounters the Basilisk, a giant chicken-snake hybrid creature that serves as one of Level 2's most dangerous beasts. The creature chases Luffy through the corridors of the prison level.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dangers of Level 2 and showcases Luffy's combat abilities even while trying to rescue Ace quickly.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Basilisk with Gear 3
events.description: Luffy activates Gear 3 and defeats the Basilisk with a powerful giant punch, showcasing his advanced fighting techniques within Impel Down's confines.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's continued use of Gear 3 and his ability to handle Level 2's threats efficiently.

events.title: Prisoners Recognize Luffy as Savior
events.description: After Luffy defeats the Basilisk, imprisoned criminals on Level 2 recognize him as their 'god of salvation' and beg to be freed from their cells.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's growing reputation even within Impel Down and sets up potential allies for the prison break.

events.title: Luffy Reunites with Mr. 3 (Galdino)
events.description: Luffy encounters Mr. 3 (Galdino), a former Baroque Works officer agent and adversary from Little Garden, who has been imprisoned in Level 2 of Impel Down. This unexpected reunion brings together former enemies.
events.significance: Reintroduces Mr. 3 to the story and sets up his crucial role in the Impel Down escape and later events at Marineford.

quotes.text: Mr. 3! What are you doing here?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's surprise at encountering his old enemy in Impel Down

events.title: Hancock Reaches Level 4
events.description: Boa Hancock, accompanied by Domino, travels on an elevator to Level 4 (Blazing Hell) where Magellan's office is located. Domino explains the extreme heat and warns about the warden.
events.significance: Advances Hancock's infiltration mission to help Luffy reach Ace, setting up the encounter with Magellan.

quotes.text: The warden's office is on Level 4: Blazing Hell.
quotes.speaker: Domino

events.title: Magellan's Daily Schedule Revealed
events.description: Domino explains to Hancock that Warden Magellan has terrible digestive problems, spending up to 10 hours a day in the bathroom and requiring 8 hours of sleep, meaning he only actively works about 4 hours daily despite being the chief warden.
events.significance: Establishes Magellan's character quirk and explains the operational dynamics of Impel Down's leadership, adding comic relief while highlighting the prison's unusual management.

quotes.text: Warden Magellan has terrible digestive problems and usually stays in the bathroom for up to 10 hours a day. He needs 8 hours of sleep, so he roughly works only 4 hours a day.
quotes.speaker: Domino
quotes.context: Explaining Magellan's unusual work schedule to Hancock

events.title: Magellan's Debut
events.description: Chief Warden Magellan makes his first appearance, revealed as an enormous figure (491 cm tall) with bat wings, horn-like ornaments, and a mandrill-like face. He is introduced as the strongest man in Impel Down.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most powerful antagonists of the Impel Down arc and establishes the major obstacle Luffy must overcome to rescue Ace.

events.title: Doku Doku no Mi Revealed
events.description: Domino warns Hancock that Magellan ate the Doku Doku no Mi (Venom-Venom Fruit), making him a Poison Human with the ability to produce and control all types of poison while having absolute immunity to toxins.
events.significance: Reveals Magellan's Devil Fruit power, establishing him as an extremely dangerous opponent whose poison abilities make him nearly unbeatable in direct combat.

quotes.text: Magellan ate the Doku Doku no Mi, meaning he's a poison man, so be careful.
quotes.speaker: Domino
quotes.context: Warning Hancock about Magellan's dangerous Devil Fruit ability

events.title: Hancock Attacks Magellan
events.description: When Magellan breathes in Hancock's direction, she becomes offended and knocks him down with an attack, demonstrating her prideful and aggressive personality even toward the prison's strongest authority figure.
events.significance: Showcases Hancock's personality and her lack of fear even toward powerful opponents, maintaining her character consistency.

events.title: Magellan Falls for Hancock
events.description: Despite being attacked by Hancock, Magellan becomes infatuated with her beauty, demonstrating the overwhelming effect of her charm even on the typically serious and stern prison warden.
events.significance: Shows the extent of Hancock's beauty and charm, which becomes a key factor in her ability to manipulate situations within Impel Down.

events.title: Hannyabal's Ambition Revealed
events.description: Vice Warden Hannyabal openly expresses his desire for Magellan to retire so he can become the chief warden, showcasing his ambitious and somewhat comedic nature through Freudian slips.
events.significance: Establishes Hannyabal's character motivation and provides comic relief while showing the internal dynamics of Impel Down's leadership.

events.title: Magellan's Poison Breath
events.description: Magellan breathes poisonous smoke at Hannyabal for his insubordinate comments, demonstrating his Devil Fruit power in action. The poison immediately affects Hannyabal, requiring an antidote.
events.significance: First demonstration of Magellan's poison abilities, showing how deadly and quick-acting his powers are, even in small doses.

events.title: Domino Calls for Antidote
events.description: After Hannyabal is poisoned by Magellan's breath, Domino immediately asks a nearby guard to fetch an antidote, showing the routine nature of Magellan's poison use and the preparedness of Impel Down staff.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Magellan's poison attacks are somewhat common within the prison and that antidotes are kept readily available.

events.title: Shiki's Silhouette Appearance
events.description: During a flashback or exposition scene, the silhouette of the legendary pirate Shiki appears, marking his first on-screen appearance in the anime one month before his official debut in One Piece Film: Strong World.
events.significance: Foreshadows Shiki's importance to the One Piece world and sets up his appearance in the upcoming film, connecting the anime to movie continuity.

quotes.text: Magellan ate the Doku Doku no Mi, meaning he's a poison man, so be careful.
quotes.speaker: Domino
quotes.context: Warning Hancock about Magellan's Devil Fruit powers

quotes.text: Warden Magellan has terrible digestive problems and usually stays in the bathroom for up to 10 hours a day.
quotes.speaker: Domino

quotes.text: Mr. 3! What are you doing here?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Surprised reunion with former enemy in Impel Down

themes.description: The episode explores how desperate circumstances force former enemies like Luffy, Buggy, and Mr. 3 to work together toward a common goal of escaping Impel Down.
themes.symbolism: The prison environment strips away past conflicts, forcing characters to unite against a greater threat.

themes.description: Magellan's introduction establishes the overwhelming power of authority within Impel Down, while also showing the cracks in that authority through his comedic weakness and Hancock's manipulation.
themes.symbolism: The prison warden represents absolute power, yet his physical weakness (digestive problems) humanizes him and shows that even the strongest have vulnerabilities.

themes.description: Luffy continues his mission to rescue Ace despite facing increasingly dangerous obstacles, including powerful creatures and the revelation of Magellan's deadly abilities.
themes.symbolism: Each level of Impel Down represents escalating challenges that test Luffy's resolve and strength.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the Chief Warden of Impel Down, Magellan is established as an imposing figure with deadly poison abilities. Despite his fearsome reputation, his digestive problems and susceptibility to Hancock's charm add unexpected depth and humor to his character.
keyActions: First appearance as the prison's strongest authority
Demonstrates poison abilities by attacking Hannyabal
Falls for Hancock's beauty despite being attacked by her

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy navigates Level 2's dangers with determination, defeating powerful beasts and gaining recognition from imprisoned criminals. His reunion with Mr. 3 shows his ability to look past old conflicts when focused on his goal.
keyActions: Gains recognition as a 'god of salvation' from Level 2 prisoners
quotes: Mr. 3! What are you doing here?!

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock continues her mission to help Luffy reach Ace, using her position as a Warlord to access deeper levels of Impel Down. Her prideful nature remains intact as she doesn't hesitate to attack even Magellan.
keyActions: Travels to Level 4 to meet Magellan
Attacks Magellan for breathing in her direction
Uses her charm to manipulate the situation

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime introduced two non-canon creatures: a Giant-Mouth Hippo and a Giant Praying Mantis in Level 2, which were not present in the manga.
The anime extended the comedic chase sequences with the Level 2 beasts, adding more slapstick comedy elements reminiscent of Tom and Jerry cartoons.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Share the World' by Tohoshinki (TVXQ) as the opening theme. The song was used for episodes 395-425.

sources.title: Share the World - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 425 marks Shiki's first on-screen appearance via silhouette, one month before his official debut in One Piece Film: Strong World (December 12, 2009).
Magellan's character design combines demonic and aquatic elements, standing at an imposing 491 cm (16'1"), making him approximately three times the height of an average human.
The episode adapts primarily Chapter 528 (pages 2-15) and Chapter 530 (page 5) of the manga.

Magellan's digestive problems are a recurring gag throughout the Impel Down arc, with him spending approximately 10 hours daily in the bathroom, limiting his actual work time to about 4 hours per day.
